iti30:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti30:2.3: It’s when someone hasn’t done good and skillful things that keep them safe, but has done bad, violent, and depraved things.
iti30:2.4: Thinking, ‘I haven’t done good things’, they’re mortified. Thinking, ‘I have done bad things’, they’re mortified.
iti30:2.5: These are the two things that are mortifying.”
iti30:2.6: That is what the Buddha said.
